serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Peak data rate
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: It is defined as the highest theoretical data rate achievable for a single device located at the best location within a cell, assuming error-free transmission conditions (i.e. excluding overhead and retransmitted data packets) when all available radio resources for the corresponding link direction are utilized.

serviceSpecCharRelationship.name: Peak data rate: DL peak data rate
Peak data rate: UL peak data rate

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Peak data rate: UL peak data rate
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: the maximum achievable upstream throughput one single device under ideal conditions.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Peak data rate: DL peak data rate
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: the maximum achievable downstream throughput at IP layer of one single device under ideal conditions.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: User data rate
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: the user experienced data rate required for the device to get a quality experience that is assumed to be enough for the considered use case.

serviceSpecCharRelationship.name: User data rate: DL user data rate
User data rate: UL user data rate

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: User data rate: DL user data rate
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: describes the experienced downstream throughput at IP layer of one single device, generated at N6 interface and measured at the device side.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: User data rate: UL user data rate
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: describes the experienced upstream throughput one single device transmitting the IP packets up to the N6 interface.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Area traffic density
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: the total traffic throughput (i.e. number of correctly received bits of IP packets per time interval) per area unit.

serviceSpecCharRelationship.name: Area traffic density: DL area traffic density
Area traffic density: UL area traffic density

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Area traffic density: DL area traffic density
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: the total throughput per area unit in the downstream direction.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Area traffic density: UL area traffic density
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: the total throughput per area unit in the upstream direction.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: 5G Quality of Service (QoS)
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: It represents a set of typical QoS parameters that are relevant for traffic handling in 3GPP networks, from Rel-15 onwards.

serviceSpecCharRelationship.name: 5G Quality of Service (QoS): DL Packet loss rate
5G Quality of Service (QoS): UL Packet loss rate
5G Quality of Service (QoS): DL Packet size
5G Quality of Service (QoS): UL Packet size:

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: 5G Quality of Service (QoS): One-way latency
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: it is the time it takes for a IP packet to travel from a device to a destination node.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: 5G Quality of Service (QoS): E2E latency
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: the time it takes for a IP packet to travel from a device to a destination node considering the Round Trip Time (RTT).

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: 5G Quality of Service (QoS): Jitter
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: it is the highest deviation in the latency value that can be acceptable for the targeted use case.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: 5G Quality of Service (QoS): DL Packet loss rate
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: it is the percentage of lost packets to the total number of packets sent in the DL direction.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: 5G Quality of Service (QoS): UL Packet loss rate
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: it is the percentage of lost packets to the total number of packets sent in the UL direction.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: 5G Quality of Service (QoS): DL Packet size
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: specifies the maximum packet size to be supported by the considered use case in the DL direction.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: 5G Quality of Service (QoS): UL Packet size
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: specifies the maximum packet size to be supported by the considered use case in the UL direction.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Availability
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: It is an indicator that represents the risk of service outage in terms of the acceptable level of unplanned downtime.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Reliability
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: It is an indicator that represents the risk of service misbehaviour within the time constraints required for the targeted use case.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Service deployment time
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: It is the time it takes the CSP to set up the network slice service (instance), with the network level guarantees specified in P.PERF_1 and P.PERF_6. This parameter measures the time that passes from service ordering (i.e. a CSC issue a service order to the CSP) to service operational readiness (i.e. the network slice service is ready to be used by the CSC). During this time, NSI day-0 (i.e. instantiation)4 and day-1 (configuration) operations shall be performed, and testing framework shall be configured accordingly.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Deployment option
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The specification of this parameter allows selecting how the 3GPP network architecture will be deployed as part of the network slice service.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Access technology
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The specification of this parameter allows selecting the technologies to be supported by the network slice service for the access part.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Predominant device type
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter lists the type of devices that can be attached to the 5G-VINNI service the CSP will provide to a CSC.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Radio spectrum
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter provides a list of the spectrum bands that can be supported by the offered service.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Radio spectrum: LTE operating bands
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: assuming option 0 has been selected for P.FUNC_2, this parameter list the LTE-defined spectrum bands [22] that can be supported by the network slice service.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Yes: P.FUNC_2 -> if set to 1, P.FUNC_4A shall be omitted.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Radio spectrum: NR operating bands
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: assuming option 1 has been selected for P.FUNC_2, this parameter list the NR-defined spectrum bands [23] that can be supported by the network slice service.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Yes: P.FUNC_2 -> if set to , P.FUNC_4B shall be omitted.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Radio spectrum: Other bands
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: allows listing bands that do not match LTE or NR, either because they are based on other access technologies (e.g. NB-IoT, LTE-M, satellite access and FWA) or because they are part of vertical-owned spectrum.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Yes: P.FUNC_2 -> only if set to 2

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Isolation
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Isolation constitutes the cornerstone for service delivery in multi-tenant environments such as 5G-VINNI, where NSIs intended for multiple CSCs will be deployed and operated on top of a shared infrastructure.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Isolation: Isolation support
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: allows specifying if isolation is required/desired for the network slice service the CSP delivers to CSC.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Isolation support: Isolation type
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: allows specifying if isolation is required/desired for the network slice service the CSP delivers to CSC.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Yes: P.FUNC_2 -> only if set to 2

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Value-added functionality
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter includes the list of advanced features that the CSP can include as part of the network slice service offered to the CSC, providing it with an enriched functionality.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Value-added functionality: 3rd party VNF hosting
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: allows a CSC to bring his own VNFs and attach them to the default service topology , expanding/modifying it to get a value-added network slice service.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Value-added functionality: Positioning
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: it is the ability to provide geo-localisation methods as part of the network slice.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Value-added functionality: Distributed data fabric
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: it is the ability to provide data fabric functionality as part of the provided network slice.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Value-added functionality: Security-as-a-Service (SECaaS)
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: it is the ability to provide automated infrastructure security to CSC, as part of the offered slice service.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Value-added functionality: Monitoring-as-a-service (MaaS)
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: allows a CSC to consume 5G-VINNI telemetry services for performance/fault activities at run-time.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Value-added functionality: Testing-as-a-service (TaaS)
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: allows a CSC to consume capabilities from the 5G-VINNI testing framework for trialling and KPI validation purposes.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Positioning
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter includes the list of advanced features that the CSP can include as part of the network slice service offered to the CSC, providing it with an enriched functionality.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Positioning: Positioning accuracy
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: specifies the accuracy required for positioning in meters. This parameter specifies an upper bound in the error between estimated position and actual position. High-precision positioning might be very important for some verticals, not only working in in-door environments, but also in outdoor.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Yes: P.FUNC_6B -> if set to “0”, P.F_9A shall be omitted

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Positioning: Measurement frequency
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: specifies how often the location information is provided.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Yes: P.FUNC_6B-> if set to “0”, P.F_9B shall be omitted.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Number of devices
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: It is defined as the maximum number of devices that can be subscribed to the network slice service

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Device density
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: It is defined as the number of devices per area unit that can maintain active connections with the network slice service. With active connection, we mean that devices are able to exchange data with the network.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Coverage profile
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: specifies the geographical areas where the devices can access the network slice service.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Coverage profile: Facility sites
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: define the list of  sites capable of supporting the deployment of the network slice service.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Coverage profile: Coverage area
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: defines the spatial boundaries where network slice service will provide coverage with a quality that is enough for the targeted use case. This quality is expressed through edge cell coverage probability, a safety factor used to determine the guaranteed level of probability (e.g. 90%, 95%, 99%) of a successful radio communication of any device placed within the specified coverage area.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Mobility
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Mobility refers to the ability of providing seamless service experiences to devices while moving. It can be defined as the maximum device speed at which a certain QoS (specified in P.PERF_4) can be achieved.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Service lifetime
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: It provides information on some aspects that deserve attention during the lifetime of a network slice service.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Service lifetime: Service duration (start-end)
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: allows CSC to specify when it wants the service running, and when it can be decommissioned. The duration for a network slice service can be highly variable, ranging from short-lived services (e.g. an uRLLC slice service provided to public safety for disaster management) to long-lasting services (e.g. an eMBB slice service provided to a MVNO.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Service lifetime: Service deactivation-activation support
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: indicates if service deactivation-activation operations (i.e. once deactivated, the service is activated again) is allowed throughout the service duration.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Service lifetime: Periodicity type
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: assuming “supported with periodicity” is selected for P.NO_5B, this parameter allows specifying if the periodicity for deactivation-activation is programmed on a daily basis (e.g. service operative during the day, and deactivated at night), weekly basis (e.g. service operative from Monday to Friday, and deactivated for the weekend) or monthly basis
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Yes: P.NO_5C-> if not set to “1”, P.NO_5E shall be omitted

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Service lifetime: Daily service deactivation-activation
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: allows programming the time interval the service shall remain deactivated (from hh:mm to hh:mm) every day.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Yes: P.NO_5C-> if not set to “0”, P.NO_5D shall be omitted.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Service lifetime: Weekly service deactivation-activation
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: allows programming the time interval the service shall remain deactivated (from dd hh:mm to dd hh:mm) every week.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Yes: P.NO_5C-> if not set to “1”, P.NO_5E shall be omitted.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Service lifetime: Monthly service deactivation-activation
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: allows programming the time interval the service shall remain deactivated (from mm-dd-yyyy hh:mm to mm-dd-yyyy hh:mm) every month.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Yes: P.NO_5C-> if not set to “2”, P.NO_5F shall be omitted.
